alert.note: Alert for McIntosh; Muskogee; Okmulgee; Wagoner (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 04 at 10:04PM CDT until May 05 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM CDT THURSDAY FOR NORTHWESTERN MUSKOGEE, CENTRAL OKMULGEE, SOUTHWESTERN WAGONER AND NORTHWESTERN MCINTOSH COUNTIES... At 1004 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen north of Okmulgee. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is likely ongoing and life threatening flash flooding could begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Okmulgee... Henryetta... Haskell... Morris... Beggs... Dewar... Schulter... Taft... Boynton... Grayson... Council Hill... Hoffman... Bald Hill... Preston... Wainwright... Redbird... Hitchita... Eram... Jamesville... Choska... This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 in Oklahoma near mile marker 238. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
